review_preview: Omg....ate here tonight. It was unreal!  Our waiter Oscar was incredible with both service and suggestions on what to order. We had a cheese stuffed tomato (to die for), grilled chicken and pesto infused cheese. Oh yes, we had dessert too, which we normally don't...
review_full: Omg....ate here tonight. It was unreal! Our waiter Oscar was incredible with both service and suggestions on what to order. We had a cheese stuffed tomato (to die for), grilled chicken and pesto infused cheese. Oh yes, we had dessert too, which we normally don't order but Oscar suggested the brownie. Excellent! Only reason I am not rating it a 5 is because of how uncomfortable the bartender and others on the way in made us feel. Not sure if we are too old (55 and 56), but we almost turned around and left.....so glad we didn't! They were making jokes and laughing. Thanks Oscar for bettering our night and making us forget about the ignorance of the front crew.

The tapas were delicious especially the gazpacho made with tomato, beetroot and strawberries. Santi, the bartender, makes amazing drinks and is very hospitable. Santi and Robert told us all the great places to go out as Inclan is right in the middle of the party area! They even gave us free VIP wristbands for entry to a bunch of bars with free shots included! You have to try the test tube shots too!!! My favourite was the blueberry and rosemary shot very responsible prices and amazing vibes! We wished we had been ready to go out because the party starts here and it's hard to leave once you start having a few drinks!

review_preview: On a recommendation from a friend we went to El Sur for a late night meal.  It was raining and there was a line out the door. We are not fans of waiting at all, much less in the rain. I can say, without a...
review_full: On a recommendation from a friend we went to El Sur for a late night meal. It was raining and there was a line out the door. We are not fans of waiting at all, much less in the rain. I can say, without a shadow of a doubt, that it was worth the wait. The host was very gracious and kept us informed on the wait time. The waiter, Oswaldo, was extremely knowledgeable, professional and courteous.  We ordered several dishes for the wife and I to share.  The Argentinian Empandas were delicious. The GambÃ¡s al Ajilo was good. It could have been great. This was the only issue we had with the entire meal. The shrimp were drowned in the sauce and there was little to no garlic in the dish. The shrimp were cooked perfectly. We finished off the meal with the Filet and Roquefort Cheese sauce. OMG! That was absolutely amazing. Not only would we go back, we'd definitely recommend this place to anyone within 30km of the location. By far, our best meal in Madrid.

title_review: Eh... maybe it was an off day
review_preview: I was looking forward to El Sur de Huertas as I kept coming across it as one of the best restaurants in Madrid.  We were able to grab a table for 3 without a reservation - all was promising until we ordered the food.  Perhaps...
review_full: I was looking forward to El Sur de Huertas as I kept coming across it as one of the best restaurants in Madrid. We were able to grab a table for 3 without a reservation - all was promising until we ordered the food. Perhaps we ordered the wrong items but the food was very bland - the gambas with garlic was definitely disappointing compared to La Casa del Abuelo, the salad was non-plus, potatoes bravas bland, some sort of pasta dish which wasn't very good. Overall, a disappointing and uninspired meal we had in Madrid - just way too many good restaurants in the city. Luckily, it was inexpensive.

We ordered a margherita pizza and a ceasar salad. The pizza was excellent, with a thin chewy crush. The dressing on the salad had too much anchovy for my taste (and too much dressing). But I suppose this is to be expected, because this is Spain and they love their anchovies! Drinks were good, but our server never brought us the second round that we ordered (nor did she charge us for them). Oh well, no big deal, there's no shortage of places to drink in Madrid!

review_preview: All the 5 star reviews are right.  My wife and I had the Angus steaks last night and we both agree, it was one of the best steaks we've ever had!  Tender and juicy, melt in your mouth meat. Our 10-year-old had the steak burger...
review_full: All the 5 star reviews are right. My wife and I had the Angus steaks last night and we both agree, it was one of the best steaks we've ever had! Tender and juicy, melt in your mouth meat. Our 10-year-old had the steak burger and announced it was one of the best burgers he's ever had. We ordered empanadas for the starter course and those were tasty as well. Even dessert, which we didn't have room for, was delicious. This place also has a remarkable level of service. The manager and server were both attentive to our needs, frequently asking if everything was OK, even bringing us water without our asking. That has NEVER happened to us before in a European restaurant! I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

title_review: Small friendly place with delicious food at a great price
review_preview: After 7 miles of museum time I limited my search to restaurants very near me.   I found a range of types and Argentinian carne sounded good.  Then the reviews sealed it.  Small friendly place with 8 tables.  They also have several seats at the counter...
review_full: After 7 miles of museum time I limited my search to restaurants very near me. I found a range of types and Argentinian carne sounded good. Then the reviews sealed it. Small friendly place with 8 tables. They also have several seats at the counter and then two fixed tables with chairs outside.  We went at 7pm which is very early for Madrilenean. Peak time is 9-10pm.  Waiter was very friendly and helpful Ordered grilled chicken and thin flank steak. Selected one side of salad and one chips (French fries).  Meal came with a small serving of secret sauce He said try a little and see if you like it. We used up every ounce of that oil as it really complemented the meat perfectly.  Side salad was perfect with a drizzle of olive oil and vinegar  Finished off with a complementary small shot of coffee liqueur which I think was Kahlua  I would not hesitate to go again.

review_preview: when I speak little Spanish, but the words of food get understood..The universal language of carne speak volumes..What a great little find..Location is prime.. but the service and meat is far greater..Super happy, smiling staff makes the enjoyment of a meal...

Location is prime.. but the service and meat is far greater.. Super happy, smiling staff makes the enjoyment of a meal so much better..  a person happy to serve you means a top rated restaurant for me... I had a small request of my meal.. no patatas and no salad.. generally itâ€™s no potatoes for me, but the salad was hard to push away..  Iâ€™m feeding the inner carnivore.. I ordered the Argentinian Lomo on the better side of medium rare, and a side of perfect salmon. On the medium side of cooked too.. What arrive was nothing short of devine intervention.. Maybe I was hungry, of course, my appetite wetted, but all boxes were ticked.. Juicy, tender, right amounts of good fats were on the steak pictured.. The knife fell thru the meat effortlessly, and devoured oh so well... The salmon, crisp on the outside, and warming thru the middle.. It was long before plates were empty my bottle of water finished, and I was paying my bill.. Please do drop by for a meal, disappointment will be left outside. I will be back at least twice before I leave.. Muchas gracias Mu!

review_preview: I dined here with my partner during a recent stay in Madrid.  A colleague, who is from Madrid, recommended it to me and I will certainly thank her when I see her again!  Mu! is an Argentinian steak restaurant with a small but fine selection...
review_full: I dined here with my partner during a recent stay in Madrid. A colleague, who is from Madrid, recommended it to me and I will certainly thank her when I see her again! Mu! is an Argentinian steak restaurant with a small but fine selection of beefy cuts, plus fish alternatives for those who don't want red meat. The menu also contains other fine Argentinian staples such as blood sausage and empanadas. I had a 350g Black Angus which was cooked perfectly and my partner had a chunky steak of salmon which, again, was cooked perfectly. We shared sides of fries and salad, accompanied by wine and beer. We barely had space for dessert but managed to share a creme caramel. In total, the meal only cost 40 EURO. Great service too. Fantastic! Highly recommended.

review_preview: My girlfriend decided that she fancied a steak, so I looked online and saw that Mu! had excellent reviews and was within walking distance. Maybe 3-4 hours later, we've just got back to our apartment and are both ridiculously well-fed (I mean ridiculously!). The starters...
review_full: My girlfriend decided that she fancied a steak, so I looked online and saw that Mu! had excellent reviews and was within walking distance. Maybe 3-4 hours later, we've just got back to our apartment and are both ridiculously well-fed (I mean ridiculously!). The starters were delicious (especially the morcilla), and we both had the black Angus steak, which was unbelievably delicious. In reality, we probably overdid it with the portions we ate (neither of us can really walk at the moment), but that steak was the best I've ever eaten, hands down. To top it off, the staff were lovely and attentive, interested in our experience and just quite impressive. Bravo all around! Also, although we didn't try it and ordered a la carte, there was a menu of the day for â‚¬10, which probably would have left us in a more reasonable state to walk home! Highly recommended to anybody who enjoys the meatier side of life!

review_preview: We found the restaurant by searching for good steak restaurants online. We were pleasantly surprised when we saw the big sign announcing their set menu deal (â‚¬10.50 for 2 different appetizers, a main course, a drink, and coffee or dessert) and even more so when...
review_full: We found the restaurant by searching for good steak restaurants online. We were pleasantly surprised when we saw the big sign announcing their set menu deal (â‚¬10.50 for 2 different appetizers, a main course, a drink, and coffee or dessert) and even more so when we saw the tubs of popcorn waiting on the tables (instead of the traditional bread). Overall, the meal was extremely affordable as well as delicious. The chorizo was excellent, the salad was fresh, the both the flank and skirt steak were of superior quality and cooked perfectly, and the ice cream was much better than we expected it to be. Even the coffee was great! We highly recommend you go there to get your steak fix.

review_preview: During my week in Madrid I ate here 3 times . Incredibly there are a few negative comments I've read but just ignore them! Yes it is very small and if you go later in the evening you will probably have to wait for a...
review_full: During my week in Madrid I ate here 3 times . Incredibly there are a few negative comments I've read but just ignore them! Yes it is very small and if you go later in the evening you will probably have to wait for a table as I once did. You have the choice to either wait or go elsewhere, so why moan about it? The fact that there are people queuing usually means it's good. Not only is it cheap, the food is remarkably good. Popcorn while you wait, empanadas , steak, ice cream, beer, bread and a complimentary fruit shot for 10â‚¬ is amazing. On my second of three visits my steak was slightly under the medium ( yeah, come on, this isn't a 5 star steak house!) So on my third visit I asked for it slightly over medium. It was spot on. The staff are all very pleasant too.

review_preview: Mu! Is a tiny place near the main shopping and tourist areas, just down a side street.Be prepared for a queue!The owner(s) were all super friendly, spoke great English and very accommodating. We started at the bar/counter and generously let us switch when...
review_full: Mu! Is a tiny place near the main shopping and tourist areas, just down a side street. Be prepared for a queue! The owner(s) were all super friendly, spoke great English and very accommodating. We started at the bar/counter and generously let us switch when a table became available. Their set menu is great value, but being on a low carb diet I plumped for the skirt steak with side salad. It came with a homemade vinegarette which had a bit of a kick. Was cooked to my liking, was very flavourful and the salad was fresh and nice too. The gf opted for the pizza which got the thumbs up, unfortunately she was unwell and couldn't finish it. No problem as they boxed it up and put the rest in a take+away bag for us. Would have dined there too on our second day, but was closed.

review_preview: First I'll start by mentioning that in the 10 days I have been in Madrid I have already been here 4 times (3 this past weekend alone), simply because of how amazing this place is, it truly lives up to its reviews/reputation. I like to...
review_full: First I'll start by mentioning that in the 10 days I have been in Madrid I have already been here 4 times (3 this past weekend alone), simply because of how amazing this place is, it truly lives up to its reviews/reputation. I like to think of myself as a steak enthusiast, I've been to many steakhouses and I can confidently say this is one of, if not the best place for steak I've had the pleasure of eating at. They know how to cook and marinade their meat without ruining the natural flavour of it, every bite is heavenly.  The value for money on the menu is exceptional, a starter(Chorizo, Morcilla, or beef/chicken empanadas), which are all amazing, a steak (personally I had the skirt and flank, and would say the flank was better), chips/salad, drink and dessert all for only 10â‚¬! This could easily be doubled in price and still be worth it, the flank steak is amazing, but the crown of MU is the Black Angus, Argentinian fillet at 20â‚¬ and separate to the menu, but the size and flavour of it makes it definitely worth the price, I would suggest this for dinner and the menu for a lunch.  And to top it all off, not only is the food amazing but the staff are too, everyone is so helpful and friendly, i brought my sister here and her steak was a bit overdone for her liking, and they happily replaced it with nothing but a smile, and was more than accommodating to my nut allergy (in the brownie). Lucas especially is so kind and will go out of his way to make sure you're experience was nothing but the best, and he's a genuine nice guy too! If you are in Madrid you HAVE to come here! I know I'll be back a couple more times before I leave.

One point for meat eaters: in Spain, meat seems to be undercooked so a medium in Spain is far less cooked than a medium in USA. Two members of our group ordered the monstrous Tomahawk steak and it came with a small table grill which came in handy because many of us put our meat on it to cook it more. Our meat was undercooked at most restaurants we visited which is why I mention this. Great value as is the case in much of Madrid for both food and drink.

title_review: Lovely spot for lunch (or dinner)--highly recommend
review_preview: I happened to walk by this place and glance at the menu after visiting the museum. I was looking for a spot with lighter fare options for a very late lunch and a few dishes on their menu caught my eye. So I decided to...
review_full: I happened to walk by this place and glance at the menu after visiting the museum. I was looking for a spot with lighter fare options for a very late lunch and a few dishes on their menu caught my eye. So I decided to step in. First off, the staff here is wonderful. I was traveling solo (mid 40s female who only speaks about 20-30 words of Spanish), and from the beginning, despite my lack of Spanish language skills, everyone who works at this restaurant was very friendly and welcoming, and I did not feel at all awkward dining on my own or made to feel that I was holding up a table for a larger party. And judging by other people dining there, they serve a fairly diverse crowd. Service and hospitality was impeccable, efficient (without being overdone), and warm. Shout out to all of the friendly wait staff, and especially to Emilio, who offered a cinnamon-rice milk liquor to top off my salmon and avocado salad (which was also perfect). I also really liked the decor--it's warm, rustic, and very inviting. If you are looking for a change from regular tapas restaurants in the area (i.e. you are visiting the Reina Sofia or Prado Museum), I highly recommend this place. I would definitely go back again if I'm in the area and try some of their other dishes.

We had the garlic prawns, croquettes, tuna avocado and their special octopus. Croquettes were melt in your mouth perfect. The prawns were smoky and slightly spicy, and we loved the generous amount of tender, sliced garlic. Tuna avocado was yummy. Their octopus was cooked so well, tender with a slight crunch, without being rubbery. Delish! Service was attentive and our waiter made recommendations for our wine which was perfect accompaniment to our meal! Highly recommended!

review_preview: Booked one hour ahead using The Fork for a table at 7.30pm on a Sunday. Our timing was good as the place was packed 20 mins later. Excellent service from very busy staff. Had 6 dishes between two all excellent. Lots of choice for vegetarians....
review_full: Booked one hour ahead using The Fork for a table at 7.30pm on a Sunday. Our timing was good as the place was packed 20 mins later. Excellent service from very busy staff. Had 6 dishes between two all excellent. Lots of choice for vegetarians. Some are nice twists on regular tapas such as the potatoes with Brutal dressing. Standout was the Burrata injected at the table using an impressive syringe with fresh pesto. The tomatoes accompanying this and the goat cheese tapas were extraordinary. Hummus was good, understated, creamy and garnished with smoked paprika. The brutal poached egg was also unusual and delicious, served with a superb onion marmalade. The wine list is quite short but broad enough and excellent value. We had the Albarino which was perfect. Bill was very reasonable. Highly recommended.

I wish my trip to Madrid has been longer so I could go back again!

review_full: This is such a charming and happy restaurant. The owner and staff go out of their way to make you feel at home. The food is absolutely delicious. The tapas are more on the medium size. We ordered 5 tapas and that was more than enough for a family of 3. My favourite would have to be the squid, followed by the prawns in garlic butter. If youâ€™re getting the prawns, donâ€™t forget to dunk the bread into the butter- absolutely divine! The seafood paella was nice too. It was quite delicate in flavour and the texture was almost silky. Everything we ordered was a winner! You really canâ€™t go wrong with any of the items on the menu. The prices are pretty good too. I wish we could stay in Madrid longer to try it all. The great thing about this place is that itâ€™s open during the day so Iâ€™d perfect if you have children and need to have an early meal.

After we got talking he gave my friend and I a glass of Sangria on the house, and it was AMAZING! The food was outstanding, I would highly recommend the Paella, it was delicious. Overall, the food, drinks and service was exceptional, my friend and I agreed it was the best meal we had during our month's stay in Madrid.

title_review: Tourist trap late night bar, not tapas restaurant
review_preview: We came here on January 3. This restaurant was our worst experience in Madrid. My wife and I came here late (after a Flamenco show, around 10:30-11pm). Although things seemed welcoming as we walked in, we slowly realized that this isn't a tapas restaurant. It...
review_full: We came here on January 3. This restaurant was our worst experience in Madrid. My wife and I came here late (after a Flamenco show, around 10:30-11pm). Although things seemed welcoming as we walked in, we slowly realized that this isn't a tapas restaurant. It was more like a late night bar serving bar food. The staff spent the entire time just talking to each other and ignored our table. When we managed to order, the food that came was poor. The jamon was the cheapest type you can get in a supermarket and this was by far our worst meal and service in Madrid. When it came time to pay, I had to ask THREE times for the bill. Each time I was told it was coming. We were sitting at the table right opposite the bar, looking impatient, credit card in hand - there was no way they didn't know we wanted to pay - they just didn't care. In the end I had to walk to the bar to insist that I pay. They all laughed to each other (my wife saw this from a distance and assumed they were trying to cheat me on the bill, so came up and checked the bill line by line... that's how in-in-your-face obnoxious the staff were). I almost walked out without paying. Don't believe the reviews - if you want authentic and good quality tapas, skip this tourist trap of a bar and go to a real restaurant.

review_preview: We booked for 8:30pm (very early by Madrid standards) - the restaurant is quite small and it otherwise appeared full. The menu was primarily full plates (raciones), many with half size (media) options, but few tapas-sized dishes. All of the food arrived within 5 minutes...
review_full: We booked for 8:30pm (very early by Madrid standards) - the restaurant is quite small and it otherwise appeared full. The menu was primarily full plates (raciones), many with half size (media) options, but few tapas-sized dishes. All of the food arrived within 5 minutes of ordering and before one of our cocktails. People were waiting for a table at the bar when we finished our food, so we decided to head off somewhere else for a post-dinner drink. We got a couple of complementary liqueurs on paying the bill. Overall the ambience, service interactions and food were good, but we were in and out in 40 minutes which detracted from the experience - hence my average rating. Perhaps if we had ordered our food in stages (like tapas) the pace may have been more relaxed.

review_full: Came on a Monday night without a reservation (around 8:30pm), they graciously were able to accommodate us on a high top table by the bar which was not an issue. If there's something I learned while in Madrid...its to make reservations at the places that take them!!! The main host (possibly the manager/owner) took great care of us, even apologizing for making us wait even though we were the ones that arrived unannounced. Ordered a pitcher of sangria â‚¬10, enough for 2-3 people. Had patatas con brutal sauce - spicy. Also ordered the risotto as well as the veal - both very tasty, wish they came in bigger portions but I guess they are technically tapas! And we ordered the paella, it's â‚¬15pp and there must be at least 2 people per table who will order it (aka â‚¬30 for the paella). Food was tasty, just as they advertise- traditional yet different - I really appreciated the creativity that went into their dishes. The service was great. Food reasonably priced, about â‚¬4-6 per plate, would definitely visit again.

title_review: Good for a group of friends, average food, hip interior.
review_preview: We turned up here with a group of 8 on a Saturday evening at 21:30 / 9:30 pm without a booking and the fantastic crew sorted out a table for us. We pretty well ordered everything on the tapas menu and it was ok, but...
review_full: We turned up here with a group of 8 on a Saturday evening at 21:30 / 9:30 pm without a booking and the fantastic crew sorted out a table for us. We pretty well ordered everything on the tapas menu and it was ok, but nothing special. I have no idea why it is rated so highly. The service was fast and efficient, but not very personal - probably had to do with the fact we had no reservation. We sat on a long table at the rear of the restaurant next to the storage room so unfortunately the staff were squeezing past all the time. If you're looking for authentic tapas, go elsewhere. If you're looking for a place to eat with a large group, for a reasonable price, try this place.

title_review: Really good italian with outstanding service
review_preview: In a centric area of Madrid, near the metro station of Tribunal, lies a charming italian restaurant with a cozy atmosphere that although at first sight it might not have an eye catching facade, it is worth visiting for a great experience. We were seated...
review_full: In a centric area of Madrid, near the metro station of Tribunal, lies a charming italian restaurant with a cozy atmosphere that although at first sight it might not have an eye catching facade, it is worth visiting for a great experience.  We were seated in a nice table that had natural light coming from the lively streets of the summer-y Madrid, with a refreshing air conditioner while we waited really short time, we were attended by their really good staff that was attentive enough to explain us thoroughly the dishes on the menu (which was in English and Spanish, depending on the customer) and clear us any doubts about them.   After deciding what to eat, the waiter kept a good distance while still taking a look on us from time to time, enough to ask something when needed, and not intrusive enough to make it any awkward, which fell on the perfect side. The food was brought and although that was my first provoleta, I must recomend it as the entrÃ©e thoroughly, we ate it as a kind of deconstructed pizza, given that we asked for extra bread (that was warm an delicious on its own), and it made me even like those sweet purple onions, and I almost always dislike them. Once we got to the main course, my friend had some Tagliatelle De Bolo (bolognese pasta) that also were pretty good. Sadly, although my calzone was good, it didn't get on the levels of the previous food and my friends, and surely not on the level of the service we got, which was outstanding. I found my calzone a bit chewy and lacking a little Je ne sais quoi. If you have some calzone needs, I might sugest you to go for the pizza, that looked outstanding on the other tables. It still was really good and left me really full, I wanted to ask for dessert, but I just was full enough that any more would be pure glutony, although I might come other day to see what they have, definitely recommended. Although at first we were greeted by some nice air conditioner, near ending our meal on the restaurant, it felt like the temperature inside rose up a bit, not plain awful, but I wished the air conditioner stayed a bit longer.  I would just recommend this restaurant just for the service. Shout out specially and foremost to Francisco for making it an awesome experience with his really good will to give us an impecable service worth of praise and the rest of the staff for their kindness.

I chose this because all pizzas contained nuts as well as the majority of pasta dishes. As soon as I ate the salad and breadsticks/bread that accompanied (after checking for content of nuts) my mouth began to tingle, this was the start of my allergic reaction. Despite clearly notifying the waiter I have since had to receive emergency treatment and it was deeply distressing.  If I had known the risk or the use of nuts/peanuts in the restaurant I wouldâ€™ve made a choice to go else where.

title_review: The most tender delicious steak I ever had!
review_preview: I was looking for a place to eat dinner before 8 and was tapased out! Stumbled upon this restaurant in trip advisor! It got great reviews do I thought why not! Boy what a treat it was! I wasn't prepared for how small the place...
review_full: I was looking for a place to eat dinner before 8 and was tapased out! Stumbled upon this restaurant in trip advisor! It got great reviews do I thought why not! Boy what a treat it was! I wasn't prepared for how small the place was but Carolina our waitress was gracious enough to give us a nice table! Of course we figured steak would be a good choice. I got the flank steak and my husband got the skirt steak! It was one of the most tender steaks I have ever had! Just melted in your mouth! It came with either fries or salad. We opted for the fries which were good. Carolina told us about the chimmicura sauce to put on the steak! Which made it even more delicious! This was a great value at only 9.50 euros! It is a couple of blocks off of the Puerto del Sol! Don't miss this place when you are in Madrid!

review_full: This was our first restaurant stop when we got to Madrid after a brief nap in the hotel room. We caught their fixed menu for lunch at almost 5pm. You can't beat what you get for the 10 euro. The appetizers were delicious, as were the patatas and steak - cooked to your order. The flan and coffee was a nice dessert. You also get a tiny little shot at the end of your meal (strawberry and orange juice with a hint of liquor when we went) and a little jelly candy with your receipt. Definitely stop by if you're hungry. Very casual, no crazy frills, and down to earth staff. Our waiter was singing along and goofing off to the radio. Made us laugh.

title_review: A glass of red wine, a sausage or empanada, a salad or fries, a steak, and a dessert - all for â‚¬10!
review_preview: There had to be a catch somewhere. â‚¬10 euros a three course menu with wine and salad or fries? Too good to be true, but it was real. There was even free popcorn. We left really full.Had it not for Gonzalo, we would have...
review_full: There had to be a catch somewhere. â‚¬10 euros a three course menu with wine and salad or fries? Too good to be true, but it was real. There was even free popcorn. We left really full. Had it not for Gonzalo, we would have missed this restaurant. It was really quite the value for money and truthfully, the food was good. The sausage and the empanada were delicious and the steak was not at all bad.  The service was good, even if one of the waiters seemed to be a bit tipsy. He was somewhat too enthusiastic. We saw him nursing a glass or beer or two. One of his colleagues even tried to stop him. When we left, we were wondering how drunk he would get.  Over-all, a very pleasant experience. If you need a break from Spanish food, then go for this one.

review_preview: 4 amigos and I sat on the grass of the Parque de El Retiro, taking in the Spanish air, content within ourselves after a wonderful weekend of music and frivolities at MadCool Festival, when we became peckish as the sun passed overhead. "Anything under 6...
review_full: 4 amigos and I sat on the grass of the Parque de El Retiro, taking in the Spanish air, content within ourselves after a wonderful weekend of music and frivolities at MadCool Festival, when we became peckish as the sun passed overhead.  "Anything under 6 euros", whimpered Joel. "I'm probably not going to eat anything", said Simon, fishing through crumpled receipts and folded boarding passes in his prized manbag for any spare coins. "Macs", declared Ben hopefully, knowing deep down inside that he would be inevitably be shot down. "I'll look up somewhere on Google", I said heroically, taking charge of the situation like a matador grasping the horns of hunger. And what a decision that was. We came across Mu! and were naturally skeptical of its low prices at first, but after reading raving reviews of the famous â‚¬10 menu, Joel miraculously found another â‚¬4 and Simon decided that Daddy's wallet could stretch a little further. And so, with the exhaust fume-filled breeze in our hair, we made our way to the restaurant.  After having narrowly avoided sideswipes from (rightfully) aggressive Spanish drivers, we set down our bags outside the establishment and took in the menu. Delightful. Almost too good to be true, surely. Nonetheless, we asked for a table for cinco and were seated within 5 minutes. The restaurant was small but welcoming, and so the wait was justified and retrospectively a small price to pay for the wonders within. We were greeted by excellent music and a trough of salted popcorn, causing us to immediately become wary of the classic trick of being drawn in by low prices and then charged for seemingly complimentary treats. Having suffered this exact fate at a small pizzeria in Mallorca a mere fortnight beforehand, the memories were still raw. We then ordered from the â‚¬10 menu (see attached), covering most of the meal options between the 5 of us and were shortly given bread with homemade chimichurri, which was delicious. Personally, I can vouch for the chorizo (and a mouthful of chicken empanada), skirt steak, chips, estrella and espresso being excellent. The meat was succulent, well-seasoned and the steak cooked to a delectable medium rare without even having to ask. By the end of the meal, we decided that there must have been a catch, but we were too satisfied to care. The final touch to this gem was a shot of Bailey's (or a similar brand of cream-based liqueur) each. We weren't complaining, but as we asked for the bill we all knew that we'd be paying more than â‚¬10 per head. The popcorn, the bread, the chimichurri and finally the Bailey's, it all seemed like a mirage in a desert of overpriced, low quality, tourist-targeted cuisine. But we opened the bill to find it was indeed a true oasis. â‚¬50. We were frankly amazed. We paid the very friendly waiter and tipped him so that we didn't leave feeling like thieves and headed into the hazy Madrid afternoon, fill both with fantastic Argentinian meat and smugness in the knowledge of our newfound retreat.  "So long, farewell" we sang harmoniously as we descended into the metro, waving shoulder to shoulder, like a scene from The Sound of Mu!sic. A tear rolled down Simon's cheek, but we swore that this would not be the last time we visited that humble eatery, so until next time, Mu!.  All our love x

Don't get me wrong, the food you get for the money is definitely a good value, however the service left me feeling pretty bad. Our order included dessert and after we finished eating the first courses we just sat patiently waiting for someone to come take our order for the dessert. We sat there for 30 minutes before we decided to ask if we could order the dessert. He took our order and then just walked away and started doing other things. It seemed like he never actually put the order in as we waited another 15 minutes for 2 slices of flan. So we asked another waiter about the flans. He was super agitated and rude and kept demanding whether I was saying flan or flanK (as in flanK steak). I was pretty thrown off guard by the way he talked to me. I also don't think what I said sounded anything like "flanK" and why in the world would I be ordering a flanK steak after I just ate meal from a menu that included dessert. Wasn't a great way to end the meal.

review_preview: Visited the Mu that is in Chinchilla near Puerta de Sol with the Missus and we had such a wonderful time there.The staff in there are incredible. They made us feel so welcome even though we arrived early in the evening and they were...
review_full: Visited the Mu that is in Chinchilla near Puerta de Sol with the Missus and we had such a wonderful time there. The staff in there are incredible. They made us feel so welcome even though we arrived early in the evening and they were clearly having a wee dinner break. They were friendly, informative and warmly welcoming. The meal itself was simply superb. My wifes Argentinian Steak was one of the best she ever had, with my Completa Milanese being a winner too. There is a excellent 10 euro menu of the day (which my wife had) and is brilliant value for those travelling on a budget. We had two course each and a couple of drinks and it only came to 28 euro. But it is the staff that make this place. The food maybe excellent, but the staff are even better. If I could give this place 10/5 I would. This is a must visit place in Madrid.

review_preview: We entered in on a Wednesday night. We had actually been intending to go to another nearby place but it was full so came here instead as it was close and we were hungry. We sat inside and it's definitely a cosy location. Only room...
review_full: We entered in on a Wednesday night. We had actually been intending to go to another nearby place but it was full so came here instead as it was close and we were hungry. We sat inside and it's definitely a cosy location. Only room for maybe 20-30 people but the location was nice and we were sat quickly at a nice table. There was a bowl of complimentary popcorn on the table which was nice start to wet our appetites. I opted for the "menu" which was excellent value for money as it included 3 courses and a drink for only â‚¬10! I had empanada, flank steak, ice cream, and a Diet Coke. The empanada was excellent, the steak was nicely cooked, but maybe a bit fatty for my taste. The fries that came with it were a little undercooked but still nice. My partner had a chicken Ceasar salad but was less impressed. The chicken was unappetising in appearance and almost had a broiled taste rather that baked or fried. All in all the waiters were great. Attentive and funny and spoke perfect English. A good experience but Madrid has better.

review_preview: MU! El Placer de la Carne (steak bar), Calle de Chinchilla 3. Very easy to find, South off Gran Via, a couple of blocks East of Plaza de Calleo (or about midway between Callao and Gran Via metro stations). Stroll down to almost the far...
review_full: MU! El Placer de la Carne (steak bar), Calle de Chinchilla 3. Very easy to find, South off Gran Via, a couple of blocks East of Plaza de Calleo (or about midway between Callao and Gran Via metro stations). Stroll down to almost the far end of Calle de Chinchilla and you're there. Very small premises with "snacky" menu, small number of tables inside and outside, plus eat at the bar. Busy when we (2) arrived, Monday around 2045, but two seats available at bar. Smallish menu with various entree, steak, burger, pizza, sides and sweets options. Beer and house wines but drinks options not extensive. Had the "black Angus" steak with fries/chips and the "complete veal burger" also with fries/chips ... "complete" being the standard veal burger plus ham, cheese and egg. Plus 2 house wine blanco/white. Steak excellent, ordered "medium", cooked medium tending medium/rare. Nicely pink and moist, tender. Veal burger also good and tasty. Fries both, nothing special (curious, Spain does mostly great food but doesn't appear to understand "great" fries) but quite edible. Wines eminently quaffable. Definitely worth a try if you're in the neighborhood or handy with the metro.

review_preview: I had been in Spain a couple of weeks on a volunteer vacation, staying at 4 Star resorts and helping Spaniards with English.  The resorts were in very rural areas, and the rooms and facilities were beautiful.  The food however, was very ordinary.On my...
review_full: I had been in Spain a couple of weeks on a volunteer vacation, staying at 4 Star resorts and helping Spaniards with English. The resorts were in very rural areas, and the rooms and facilities were beautiful. The food however, was very ordinary. On my last weekend, a Friday and Saturday in Madrid, I checked into my hotel just off the Gran Via. I looked at trip advisor and saw this place was only a block away and had great reviews. I'm guessing it was around 8 or 9 so I headed out looking for dinner.  It turned out this was only about a half block from my hotel, I could see it from the entrance. I walked up the cobblestone streets and looked in. It was a tiny tiny place, but already packed, except for a place at the bar. I sat down and took a look at the menu. I got a flatiron steak with chimichurri and a green salad, topped off with an Estrella beer.  This is a Brazilian steakhouse and I am thinking the steak was $11 Euros and with salad and beer the entire mean was under $20 Euros....AND they gave me a shot of some Irish Cream with something spicy in it just before I paid. All the guys who worked here, and the people who were eating here were happy and fun. It has a lot of energy, and the food is fantastic.  I would definitely recommend this for one or two people. It's awesome.

title_review: Superb food, drinks, atmosphere and brilliant staff
review_preview: We've been recommended by our friend to visit InClan Brutal Bar - he said that we wont be disappointed. And he was right! The food was absolutely delicious, fabulous cocktails and very innovative way of serving them!Firstly I tried to book a table via...
review_full: We've been recommended by our friend to visit InClan Brutal Bar - he said that we wont be disappointed. And he was right! The food was absolutely delicious, fabulous cocktails and very innovative way of serving them! Firstly I tried to book a table via Facebook - but the system is only set-up for the groups of 9. So I messaged them and got the reply Right away. Still had to call the restaurant - but my messages were answered in a really nice manner.  Later in the evening had to call them to say we are late for dinner but they said they will keep a table for us. Once we arrived - we were told we have a bit more than 1.5hour for our dinner - which was fine with us as it was our fault we couldn't make it on time. Atmosphere was electric in that place - so busy (but in a good way). Everything was served in a good time, we never had to wonder if food or drinks are missing. Oscar (who was our waiter) was a superstar! Santiago also made us feel very welcomed. There was another man (didn't get his name) but he was setting up a table close to us and asked if its ok if he will place a chair at the corner of other table so the person will sit back to us. We didn't think it was tight so we agreed and were awarded for it with some shots :) Highly recommend this place for food & drink lovers - top notch!

Generous servings for tapas and I much prefer that bread is served warm and crusty in its own basket and not as toast under the tapas food. Our waiter was Peter who was very attentive, and the other waiters and bar attendants likewise. We were given a free liqueur at the end of each meal. If you have room st the end they have a delicious cheesecake which is New York style and not too sweet.

They were out of some ingredients that lead to 3 or 4 menu items not being available but the other options turned out great.

review_preview: The quality of the food and the atmosphere stop this from being the most dire dining experience I've ever had in my life. We had a reservation for 8:30, but we showed up at 8:15. Although there was one person serving at the bar and...
review_full: The quality of the food and the atmosphere stop this from being the most dire dining experience I've ever had in my life. We had a reservation for 8:30, but we showed up at 8:15. Although there was one person serving at the bar and three on the floor, they all ignored us for nearly 20 minutes. There was a growing line of people behind us, but despite it all, the waiters hustled around the place, refusing to even pick up their eyes to see if anybody might want to find a table. Once we were finally seated, it took another 15 minutes to even get a waiter's attention to take our order. We ordered everything at once because it was becoming evident that this was going to be a bit of an ordeal. It took another 15 minutes for my wife's drink to show up. Mine didn't show up for another 15 minutes after that. It took 30 minutes for one cocktail! The food showed up before it did! The food itself was tasty, though slightly cold and certainly not worth how long we waited for it. Throughout the time we were there, at least five more tables were seated, served, and cleared. The wait staff chatted with each other, occasionally glancing over at us, but generally seemed disinterested and amateur. Trendy or not, good reviews or not, this was a horrendous experience. For the rest of our stay in Madrid, we didn't bother making reservations and stopped into random places. Sometimes that's the best way to experience a new city. Maybe our experience was a one-off or maybe we failed to adapt to Spanish standards of service, but this place missed on every level.

review_preview: Inclan Brutal Bar is tricky to review.  On the one hand, the food and drinks are very tasty and very reasonably priced, and they are served by very competent and friendly staff in a comfortable environment: so that's all good.  On the other hand, it...
review_full: Inclan Brutal Bar is tricky to review. On the one hand, the food and drinks are very tasty and very reasonably priced, and they are served by very competent and friendly staff in a comfortable environment: so that's all good. On the other hand, it all feels a bit contrived and tourist-focussed. (For instance, our tickets for a free walking tour including a coupon on the back for a free sangria at Inclan. Clearly, they're marketing to tourists with that strategy.) I think the tastes are relatively authentic -- it's sort of a modern, lighter spin on some classic Spanish dishes -- and the food is tasty, but it feels a bit like going to a slightly Disneyland-esque recreation of a Spanish tapas restaurant. You'll enjoy yourself, but it felt a bit hollow.

My partner chose Chicken curry, really good and I chose the stuffed chicken, again wonderfully cooked and so tasty. Were were full but our host kindly brought us the best cheesecake ever as a freebie along with a baileys each and we polished them off. This restaurant certainly deserves to be up there with the best, it was fantastic. It was a long walk from our hotel but certainly well worth it. Would definitely recommend this place and if we are in Madrid in the future we will be back . Service, food and value all excellent .

title_review: Great restaurant with even greater service
review_preview: I could talk about how good the meals were everyday for both lunch and dinner or I could talk about the great beer selection and amazing gin & tonics. However, I want to talk about how friendly and warm the staff at Taberna El Sur...
review_full: I could talk about how good the meals were everyday for both lunch and dinner or I could talk about the great beer selection and amazing gin & tonics. However, I want to talk about how friendly and warm the staff at Taberna El Sur de Huertas are. Everyday, I was welcomed in like an old friend and by my last night in Madrid I was really wishing I was a local to come here everyday after work. If you want to have a lovely meal with some great drinks then I would try this place, you'll be taken care of and looked after. Would love to come back someday. Thanks again for everything guys. Big thank you to Rebeca, Miguel, Eddy, Andres, Frank and Jose. You looked after me like family and made some great memories for me. Gracias Amgios.

review_preview: I often hear from people that you can't trust TA because it is rigged. Since I am a level 6 contributor I don't want to believe that is true but after going to this restaurant it makes me wonder. There is no way this is...
review_full: I often hear from people that you can't trust TA because it is rigged. Since I am a level 6 contributor I don't want to believe that is true but after going to this restaurant it makes me wonder. There is no way this is one of the top restaurants in Madrid.  I made reservations at this restaurant through the TripAdvisor app for Saturday night. It was strangely empty although The Fork said there were only early bookings available. The service was spotty and the food was mediocre. We had the paella which was bland. The sangria tasted like old wine with some ice cubes thrown into it. The burrata infused with pesto was a huge ball of cheese with 3 cherry tomotaoes. It needed more tomatoes to balance out the cheese. The tuna was loaded down in a heavy sauce and even so didn't have much flavor. I saw mostly tourists at the restaurant probably people who read about it on TA. This place is fine if you are starving and stumble into the restaurant. Definitely don't plan an evening around it.

review_preview: A cool 'Hipster' Steak House on one of Madrid's side streets. Very limited seating but don't let a full house appearance stop you from wandering in.You'd be surprised where they can fit you. You can sit at the Bar or at a table. Not your...
review_full: A cool 'Hipster' Steak House on one of Madrid's side streets. Very limited seating but don't let a full house appearance stop you from wandering in.You'd be surprised where they can fit you. You can sit at the Bar or at a table. Not your usual dim candle lit ambience steak house. It feels more like a fast food burger joint. But the food is another story. After ordering my meal a bowl of fresh popcorn was placed on my table which I wasn't charged for. Nice! My starter was chorizo sausage. Served on it's own with no dressings. Delicious! A fresh bread roll arrived with this. The steak was amazing. Black Angus medium with fries. My Red Wine was Tinto De La Casa. I had Ice Cream for dessert and was given a free lemon liqueur to finish. Friendly efficient staff made the whole experience memorable. The bill inc 2 glasses of wine came to â‚¬32.50. Great value indeed. Well done Mu! A reputation well deserved!

title_review: Beautiful food in middle of Madrid
review_preview: Out walking the streets seeing the sights and I happen across Oven.  The first thing that catches my eye, is the menu on the front door.  Which was bilingual, ie there was the English ğŸ˜€.   The second thing was when I went in, how busy...
review_full: Out walking the streets seeing the sights and I happen across Oven. The first thing that catches my eye, is the menu on the front door. Which was bilingual, ie there was the English . The second thing was when I went in, how busy the place is. Two good signs of great food. And I'm pleased to say I was not let down by my experience. The staff we're brilliant, and easily switch to English for me, making for a calm smooth ordering experience. Through out my lunch, the food was quick to the table (even though they were busy), beautifully cooked, and served with a smile. Definently put this one on your list to visit should you happen to Madrid. To guarantee a table I suggest booking first, but even a small wait is worth it.

Very welcoming service! Will definitely go back.

title_review: The greatest waiter ever and terrific affordable food 5 stars
review_preview: To my favorite waiter, (from Venezuela) I apologize for the delay and not mentioning you by name. We have misplaced the paper with your name.  On our first visit, we didnâ€™t expect much as we were right in the centre of the shopping madness.  Opened...
review_full: To my favorite waiter, (from Venezuela) I apologize for the delay and not mentioning you by name. We have misplaced the paper with your name.  On our first visit, we didnâ€™t expect much as we were right in the centre of the shopping madness. Opened the door and saw how small the place was. A young (to us seniors) man gave us a big smile and welcomed us. He had one table empty. He introduced himself and explained the menu. Can you believe a 3 course meal with a glass of wine for 10â‚¬? Well, Iâ€™m so happy we tried it.  Throughout the menu, he would stop at the table and chat a little. It was obvious he took servicing clients seriously. He answered all our questions and gave us recommendations. My husband and I ordered the same. The chorizo was very nicely spiced. The ribs, the cut unlike what I am accustomed to in Canada, was very tender and the ice cream,... oh, the red wine served in a big wine glass also tasted great. He made us feel at home. So much so that we returned the following night. He immediately recognized us and seemed genuinely happy to see us again. He impressed me again as he remembered what changes, or not, we made to our order the night before. I was surprised to find out later that he took our orders but was not serving our table that night. He laughed and told this eveningâ€™s waiter â€œ these are my friends. Be niceâ€. The food was as delicious and I wished I had discovered Emu earlier on in our visit to beautiful Madrid. Thank you to all the staff at Mu Iâ€™m trying to tap the 5 star rating but it wonâ€™t let me

review_preview: The Inclan Brutal bar is a fun place to grab a drink and a bite and a great launch pad for so many other places in the area.  It's in a part of town where there are a lot of choices, so if you don't...
review_full: The Inclan Brutal bar is a fun place to grab a drink and a bite and a great launch pad for so many other places in the area. It's in a part of town where there are a lot of choices, so if you don't have a reservation, you are not out of luck. The chic at the door (Great to meet you Frieda) was very nice and welcoming. My table-mates were 30 minutes late but she held our table. She is used to the Iberian sense of time. In the meantime I hung out at the bar, where they do not skimp on the pours. This is a semi-open kitchen kind of place. It has the feel of a chain from the looks of the menus, but feels more like an independent from the service. We enjoyed some very nice Paella. It took quite some time to prepare (always a good sign). The Hummous was fantastic. I also had an excellent mojito.  The prices were very reasonable.  There are many choices for dinner in Madrid and I am sure if you make this choice you will not regret it.

title_review: A blueprint on how other restaurants could be
review_preview: Located down a side street this restaurant was small but could accommodate us without a reservation. The setting is simple (not intimate) but don't let that worry you on what you get in the service or food quality.The service is really attentive and quick...
review_full: Located down a side street this restaurant was small but could accommodate us without a reservation. The setting is simple (not intimate) but don't let that worry you on what you get in the service or food quality. The service is really attentive and quick (in fact a little too much at one point when they tried to clear our plates whilst still eating).  Along with many others we opted for the 10 Euro meal deal. The food was really tasty and the steak was a really good cut of meat and cooked perfect. To get 3 courses including a steak meal amongst hundreds of other expensive places in Madrid seems to be a great marketing approach. With the meal bread was included where other restaurants charge - and we even got a tasty shot at the end and sweets whilst we settled the bill. All small touches which prove if they can do it for 10 Euro what prevents other restaurants doing the same? Would happily make a return visit.

title_review: The best inexpensive steak you'll ever have
review_preview: This restaurant was very inexpensive, but we ate as if we were at an expensive restaurant. We ordered 3 menu del dÃ­as at 10 euros each. The menu del dÃ­a comes with a first and second course, a salad, a dessert, and drinks. For the...
review_full: This restaurant was very inexpensive, but we ate as if we were at an expensive restaurant. We ordered 3 menu del dÃ­as at 10 euros each. The menu del dÃ­a comes with a first and second course, a salad, a dessert, and drinks. For the first course, we got a blood sausage, a spicy sausage, and a salad. They were all delicious! The salad was simple but had very fresh ingredients. Their main courses were spectacular. We had the flank steak and ribs, which were very tender and cooked to a perfect medium, as we requested. Their chicken was juicy and savory. The service was excellent. For dessert, we had a flan and an arroz con leche. Both were quite good. At the end, they treated us to a couple of free shots!! The service was great throughout , and the guy spoke excellent english putting my limited Spanish to shame. We chose a chicken Caesar salad to share, it was really tasty and delicious, we had time to enjoy before the main courses arrived. Seafood paella and solomillo with goats cheese. The paella wasnâ€™t amazing ,the seafood a little over cooked but still very filling. The steak looked excellent and was very popular a large filling portion this was off of the specials menu. We were given a complimentary coffee liqueur and a slice of caramel dessert. A good experience and good value.

title_review: My God, this place is Re-donk-ulously amazing!!
review_preview: First off, I find sometimes in Madrid the waitstaff to be a bit slow and not super attentive to the diner's needs.  Well, this place is different!  Andres was my waiter and he was right on point with everything and I didn't have to wait...
review_full: First off, I find sometimes in Madrid the waitstaff to be a bit slow and not super attentive to the diner's needs. Well, this place is different! Andres was my waiter and he was right on point with everything and I didn't have to wait for a thing. Talk about being attentive in spades!!! Ask for him if you go, you will NOT be disappointed in the service. I started with a white sangria. I think an angel came down from Heaven to deliver this drink. It was so good, and I'm not a sangria person. So good. So, dinner started out on a really great note. Well, it only got better. I had the shredded beef (Ropa). Oh my god, this melted in my mouth. If you dine here and miss this dish, you are doing yourself a disservice.  From there I had the succulent shrimp in a butter/garlic sauce that I'm not embarrassed to admit I would've sipped from the bowl. How good you ask? THAT GOOD! I proceeded to have a red sangria that was just as Heavenly(I'm leaning towards the white as my favorite), and finished with some beef tenderloins. I'm sad because I'm back home and can't dine here everyday! Awesome atmosphere, great service, and absolutely delicious food. This is a must in Madrid!!!! Go there......Yesterday!!!!!!!!! GO!!!

title_review: Could this be the best place for breakfast in Madrid?
review_preview: Oh wow!!  I've been to a couple of other great places in Madrid for breakfast (Mision and HanSo) but I think we have a winner for which place does the best breakfast food.  Here!  The Eggs Zenith (10E) was so good that my words won't...

The staff speak really good English, I get a sense that there is a strong American connection to this place. One staff member, she was definitely from the US and so seemed to be a lot of the people eating there. Very safe, very female friendly (I think I was the only man in there!).  Well worth a visited, and more than once!

title_review: traditional but amazing rural cuisine_ real food
review_preview: I arrived late the midday service ended at 4.00 pm and I arrived at 4.10- the lovely couple who run it kept the restaurant open for me so we were the only customers- they were so enthusiastic about the food and so unbelievably friendly and...
review_full: I arrived late the midday service ended at 4.00 pm and I arrived at 4.10- the lovely couple who run it kept the restaurant open for me so we were the only customers- they were so enthusiastic about the food and so unbelievably friendly and helpful- they speak no English but we got by using a Translator App on the phone which added to the fun!-anyway, on to the food itself; if you want authentic Spanish food from the region then this is the place for you but a warning here, itâ€™s not for the faint hearted, no foams or twills, her cuisine is based mainly on hand reared pig so if you are looking for paella seafood beef etc itâ€™s not for you. The food is amazing, some Iâ€™ve never had or heard of before, totally authentic - mainly pig ( every part !) and also partridge/fowl, salted cod- totally delicious& reasonably priced and unlike most taster menus there is plenty of it. I cannot recommend this place highly enough and a must for serious foodies- wine was excellent and cheap!

Nothing like this 5 star posh restaurant but the food was cooked with love and tradition. This little small restaurant will surprise you with food that you would die for. It is one of those place that you have to visit and experience. A bottle of wine starter, main, dessert 3 different Spirits all included â‚¬40 per person but I booked on the fork 30% off. One thing to warn is that it is a lot of food so you may want to have a very little light breakfast or lunch. We went there for lunch. My explanation of foods may not be 100 % correct but you can go, taste and find out. A must go ! Seriously amazing experience.

There was only one course, 6 dishes with red wine, that was eventually 7 dishes, 3 sweets, 3 spirits and abundant red wine. Fee for it was 40 euros per person, but we could get 30% discount thanks to TripAdvisor.  Among the dishes, we especially liked chorizo, gazpacho, poteto & cod postage, and quail stewed with chocolate. All in unassuming style, but were tastful enough. Fully enjoyed two-hour lunch and we were really full and satisfied.

review_full: We were looking to celebrate our last day in Madrid with a good meal and stumbled upon Taberna Mas Al Sur in walking distance from our hotel. We were greeted very warmly by Matias who was part of the morning team. We were the first ones in the empty restaurant but soon, the restaurant began to fill up and it looks like it was a popular spot for lunch. I told Matias that I wanted to have seafood and he recommended the seafood paella. We also ordered the risotto and both were excellent dishes. Food came out promptly and eventhough the restaurant got busy, the morning team continuously gave excellent service and never gave us any less attention. I've already saved this restaurant in my favourites list so that I know where to find it when I come back to Madrid again. Highly recommended and hope to see Matias again soon! If in doubt, get the risotto!

review_full: Overall I was a bit disappointed by the restaurant as the reviews are so over the top, but I can say the calamari rings were the best I have eaten in a long time. They had the perfect amount of bread and were tender, not chewy. We also had a salad (not special) and then salmon with melted cheese on top. We ordered this as we thought it was interesting. It was interesting but the salmon was overcooked so it was quite dry. I wouldn't order that again. Our server was very helpful and attentive. Overall a fine experience but I think there are better tapas bars in town.

review_preview: The restaurant was not easy to find and it looked closed from outside, but after we knocked on the door, we were let it :-) They serve a nice home cousine from the 16th century from the center of Spain. The menu is fixed and...
review_full: The restaurant was not easy to find and it looked closed from outside, but after we knocked on the door, we were let it :-)  They serve a nice home cousine from the 16th century from the center of Spain. The menu is fixed and has many courses, such as vegetables chutney, sossage, cod dish, baked poultry shah, poultry pate, quail cooked in several ways (here you can choose from), and a wonderful dessert mix. All very original, we have never tried anything like that before and we liked most really a lot. All the dishes were explained by the owner :-) nice! Service was fast and non-intrusive. If you want to try something really special - here you go.

review_preview: Found this restaurant on our first evening in Madrid as it was very close to the hotel. Unprepossesing door which you had to knock to gain entrance. The husband and wife owners speak no  English. There is no menu. You have a tasting menu of...
review_full: Found this restaurant on our first evening in Madrid as it was very close to the hotel. Unprepossesing door which you had to knock to gain entrance. The husband and wife owners speak no English.  There is no menu. You have a tasting menu of manchegan dishes which are explained by the wife in Spanish so it can be a bit of a surprise when the dish arrives. There are two dishes based on bacalao which some of our party found a bit too fishy for them. The main dish was quail in a chocolate sauce. Red wine was served from a pitcher but little if any white wine available. Three local spirits provided with coffee. Cost per head was â‚¬40 but got a 30% discount by booking on the fork app. A memorable evening of 6 or 7 dishes.

review_preview: We choose this out of the several restaurants on the same block because it just looked more inviting than the rest and the service and food did not disappoint. We thought we'd uncovered a hidden gem - so imagine our surprise when we came to...
review_full: We choose this out of the several restaurants on the same block because it just looked more inviting than the rest and the service and food did not disappoint. We thought we'd uncovered a hidden gem - so imagine our surprise when we came to this site to review Taberna - it was already so highly rated and no wonder why. The seafood risotto was amazing, the chicken curry was a delight to our 8 year old, and the croquettas were wonderful. But none of those topped the grilled octopus which had just the PERFECT amount of chipotle to add a nice spicy note without overwhelming the taste of the octopus. Our 10 year old gave it 5 stars. :) The service was terrific. They treated us as if we were long absent friends, welcomed us with warmth, made sure our every need was looked after and wowed our kids with their friendliness.  There are many options in this neighborhood - I cannot imagine how any could top Taberna. We'd rate it six stars if we could.
